alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 1:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Colorado, including the following county, Grand. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1259 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.1 and 0.2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern Grand County - This includes the following additional locations... Columbine Lake, rising water in the Colorado River along River Rd, Lower Stillwater Creek, Stillwater Pass, Upper Willow Creek Valley, Middle Willow Creek Valley and Lower Willow Creek Valley.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry gulches is likely. The heavy rains may trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain. Heavy Rainfall may cause minor flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the East Troublesome burn area. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows.
